mods.abstract: RUNAWAY! RUNAWAY from the undersigned on Sicily Island, in this parish on the morning of the 7th May, 1857, a negro woman of black color, about 20 years old named HESTER. Said negro took with her her child -- a boy, aged about 2 years, copper color, named Harmon. -- The said girl was purchased in New Orleans, and I judge she will try to make her way back. I will reward any person liberally who will deliver the woman and child to me or lodge her in any jail. H.L. Green. Concordia Intelligencer copy and send bill to tis office. May 7, 1857. 1tf
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
